course_overview.course_description:
This course provides a comprehensive introduction to Git and GitHub, focusing on software configuration and collaborative development practices for beginner learners. Participants will learn to manage repositories, create branches, and integrate software products using appropriate Git scripts. The course emphasizes practical application through hands-on exercises covering repository management, issue tracking, and pull requests, ensuring learners can effectively collaborate on software projects. 

Furthermore, the course explores modern development tools such as GitHub Actions, Copilot, and Codespaces to automate workflows and enhance productivity. Learners will also gain essential skills in security and administration, including dependency management, code scanning, and user authentication. By mastering these skills, participants will improve their ability to diagnose configuration issues, optimize deployment processes, and contribute to secure and efficient software development, increasing their employment and job upgrading opportunities.

KA_Analysis.K1: For K1: Practical exercises directly assess understanding of script/tool types and usage for integration and deployment.
KA_Analysis.A1: For A1: Analyzing release components is evaluated through practical tasks where trainees identify and examine elements.
KA_Analysis.K2: For K2: Software configuration procedures are directly assessed in practical exercises, where trainees configure software.
KA_Analysis.A2: For A2: Coordination is assessed via practical tasks where trainees must communicate during simulated release scheduling.
KA_Analysis.K3: For K3: Configuration test knowledge is assessed through identifying purposes in practical exercises.
KA_Analysis.A3: For A3: Practical exercises require trainees to choose appropriate scripts/tools, assessing selection skills.
KA_Analysis.K4: For K4: Interpreting configuration test results is assessed by analyzing output during practical exercises.
KA_Analysis.A4: For A4: Software configuration skills are evaluated directly through hands-on configuration tasks in practicals.
KA_Analysis.K5: For K5: Practical tasks will indirectly show knowledge of deployment process elements when trainees perform them.
KA_Analysis.A5: For A5: Practical exercises directly assess executing config tests during hands-on activities.
KA_Analysis.A6: For A6: Practical work and configuration test results are analysed to diagnose issues surfaced from configuration testing
KA_Analysis.A7: For A7: Improvements are identified by trainees during exercises, assessing their analytical and improvement skills.
KA_Analysis.A8: For A8: Implementing modifications is directly assessed by evaluating successful changes made during practicals.
